name: Cheri Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from paralysis on its own in battle.

name: Chesto Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from sleep on its own in battle.

name: Pecha Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from poisoning on its own in battle.

name: Rawst Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from a burn on its own in battle.

name: Aspear Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from being frozen on its own in battle.

name: Leppa Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore 10 PP to a depleted move during battle.

name: Oran Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its own HP by 10 points during battle.

name: Persim Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from confusion on its own in battle.

name: Lum Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from any status condition during battle.

name: Sitrus Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its own HP by a small amount during battle.

name: Figy Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause confusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Wiki Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause confusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Mago Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause confusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Aguav Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause confusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Iapapa Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause confusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Razz Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Coolness. Its red flesh is spicy when eaten.

name: Bluk Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty. Its blue flesh is dry when eaten.

name: Nanab Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cuteness. Its pink flesh is sweet when eaten.

name: Wepear Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness. Its green flesh is bitter when eaten.

name: Pinap Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Toughness. Its yellow flesh is sour when eaten.

name: Pomeg Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its HP base points.

name: Kelpsy Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its Attack base points.

name: Qualot Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its Defense base points.

name: Hondew Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its Sp. Atk base points.

name: Grepa Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its Sp. Def base points.

name: Tamato Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its Speed base points.

name: Cornn Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Magost Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cuteness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Rabuta Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Nomel Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Toughness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Spelon Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cuteness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Pamtre Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Watmel Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Durin Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Belue Berry
effect: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Occa Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Fire-type attack.

name: Passho Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Water-type attack.

name: Wacan Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Electric-type attack.

name: Rindo Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Grass-type attack.

name: Yache Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Ice-type attack.

name: Chople Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Fighting-type attack.

name: Kebia Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Poison-type attack.

name: Shuca Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Ground-type attack.

name: Coba Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Flying-type attack.

name: Payapa Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Psychic-type attack.

name: Tanga Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Bug-type attack.

name: Charti Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Rock-type attack.

name: Kasib Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Ghost-type attack.

name: Haban Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Dragon-type attack.

name: Colbur Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Dark-type attack.

name: Babiri Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Steel-type attack.

name: Chilan Berry
effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one Normal-type attack.

name: Liechi Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Attack stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Ganlon Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Defense stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Salac Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Speed stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Petaya Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Atk stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Apicot Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Def stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Lansat Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its critical-hit ratio will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Starf Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, one of its stats will sharply increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Enigma Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, being hit by a supereffective attack will restore its HP.

name: Micle Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its accuracy will increase just once when it’s in a pinch.

name: Custap Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it will be able to move first just once when it’s in a pinch.

name: Jaboca Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a physical attack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will also be hurt.

name: Rowap Berry
effect: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a special attack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will also be hurt.

name: Bright Powder
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky glare that lowers the opposing Pokémon’s accuracy.

name: White Herb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It will restore any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

name: Quick Claw
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This light, sharp claw lets the bearer move first occasionally.

name: Mental Herb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder shakes off move-binding effects to move freely. It can be used only once.

name: Kings Rock
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder successfully inflicts damage, the target may also flinch.

name: Smoke Ball
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon encounter without fail.

name: Focus Band
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder may endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

name: Scope Lens
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a lens for scoping out weak points. It boosts the holder’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Leftovers
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder’s HP is slowly but steadily restored throughout every battle.

name: Shell Bell
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder restores a little HP every time it inflicts damage on others.

name: Lax Incense
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The beguiling aroma of this incense may cause attacks to miss its holder.

name: Wide Lens
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a magnifying lens that slightly boosts the accuracy of moves.

name: Muscle Band
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband exudes strength, slightly boosting the power of physical moves.

name: Wise Glasses
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This thick pair of glasses slightly boosts the power of special moves.

name: Expert Belt
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a well-worn belt that slightly boosts the power of supereffective moves.

name: Light Clay
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Protective moves like Light Screen and Reflect will be effective longer.

name: Life Orb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the power of moves but at the cost of some HP on each hit.

name: Power Herb
effect: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the holder to immediately use a move that normally requires a turn to charge.

name: Focus Sash
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder has full HP, it will endure a potential KO attack with 1 HP. The item then disappears.

name: Zoom Lens
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder moves after its target moves, its accuracy will be boosted.

name: Metronome
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts moves used consecutively but only until a different move is used.

name: Destiny Knot
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder becomes infatuated, the opposing Pokémon will be, too.

name: Black Sludge
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It gradually restores HP to Poison-type Pokémon. It damages any other type.

name: Icy Rock
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the move Hail when used by the holder.

name: Smooth Rock
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the move Sandstorm when used by the holder.

name: Heat Rock
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the move Sunny Day when used by the holder.

name: Damp Rock
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the move Rain Dance when used by the holder.

name: Grip Claw
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of multi-turn attacks, such as Bind and Wrap.

name: Shed Shell
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This discarded carapace enables the holder to switch out of battle without fail.

name: Big Root
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the amount of HP the holder restores from HP-stealing moves.

name: Razor Claw
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sharply hooked claw increases the holder’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Razor Fang
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder successfully inflicts damage, the target may also flinch.

name: Eviolite
effect: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When held by a Pokémon that can still evolve, it raises both Defense and Sp. Def.

name: Float Stone
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This very light stone reduces the weight of a Pokémon when held.

name: Rocky Helmet
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is hit, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

name: Air Balloon
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder will float in the air until hit. Once the holder is hit, this item will burst.

name: Red Card
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder is hit by an attack, the attacker is removed from battle.

name: Ring Target
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Moves that normally have no effect will land on a Pokémon holding it.

name: Binding Band
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a band that increases the power of binding moves used by the holder.

name: Absorb Bulb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Atk if the holder is hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

name: Cell Battery
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if the holder is hit with an Electric-type attack. It can only be used once.

name: Eject Button
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is hit by an attack, it will be switched out of battle.

name: Pass Orb
effect: A mysterious orb containing the power of the Unova region, to be used when generating Pass Power.

name: Weakness Policy
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Attack and Sp. Atk sharply increase if the holder is hit with a move it’s weak to.

name: Assault Vest
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive vest raises Sp. Def but prevents the use of status moves.

name: Luminous Moss
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def if the holder is hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

name: Snowball
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if the holder is hit with an Ice-type attack. It can only be used once.

name: Safety Goggles
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These goggles protect the holder from both weather-related damage and powder.

name: Adrenaline Orb
effect: If held by a Pokémon, it boosts Speed when intimidated.

name: Terrain Extender
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder’s move or Ability.

name: Protective Pads
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects caused by making direct contact with the target.

name: Electric Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Psychic Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Misty Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Grassy Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Choice Band
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious headband boosts Attack but only allows the use of one move.

name: Choice Scarf
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious scarf boosts Speed but only allows the use of one move.

name: Choice Specs
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious glasses boost Sp. Atk but only allow the use of one move.

name: Toxic Orb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb that will badly poison the holder during battle.

name: Flame Orb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb that will afflict the holder with a burn during battle.

name: Iron Ball
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It lowers Speed and allows Ground-type moves to hit Flying types and holders that are levitating.

name: Lagging Tail
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is tremendously heavy and makes the holder move slower than usual.

name: Sticky Barb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It damages the holder every turn and may latch on to Pokémon that touch the holder.

name: Full Incense
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense makes the holder bloated and slow moving.

name: Potion
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Full Restore
effect: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the HP of a single Pokémon and heal any status conditions it has.

name: Max Potion
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to completely restore the max HP of a single Pokémon.

name: Hyper Potion
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Super Potion
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Fresh Water
effect: Water with high mineral content. It can be used to restore 30 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Soda Pop
effect: A highly carbonated soda drink. It can be used to restore 50 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Lemonade
effect: A very sweet and refreshing drink. It can be used to restore 70 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Moomoo Milk
effect: A bottle of highly nutritious milk. It can be used to restore 100 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Energy Powder
effect: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Energy Root
effect: An extremely bitter medicinal root. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Berry Juice
effect: A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Sweet Heart
effect: A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.

name: Revive
effect: A medicine that can be used to revive a single Pokémon that has fainted. It also restores half of the Pokémon’s max HP.

name: Max Revive
effect: A medicine that can be used to revive a single Pokémon that has fainted. It also fully restores the Pokémon’s max HP.

name: Revival Herb
effect: A terribly bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokémon and fully restores its max HP.

name: Sacred Ash
effect: This rare ash can revive all fainted Pokémon in a party. In doing so, it also fully restores their max HP.

name: Master Ball
effect: The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

name: Ultra Ball
effect: An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball.

name: Great Ball
effect: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a standard Poké Ball.

name: Poke Ball
effect: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target.

name: Safari Ball
effect: A special Poké Ball that was used in the Safari Zone in the Kanto region and in the Great Marsh in the Sinnoh region.

name: Park Ball
effect: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

name: Sport Ball
effect: A special Poké Ball that was used during the Bug-Catching Contest in the Johto region.

name: Antidote
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can be used to lift the effects of being poisoned from a single Pokémon.

name: Burn Heal
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used to heal a single Pokémon suffering from a burn.

name: Ice Heal
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating freezing. It can be used to thaw out a single Pokémon that has been frozen solid.

name: Awakening
effect: A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can be used to rouse a single Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

name: Paralyze Heal
effect: A spray-type medicine for treating paralysis. It can be used to free a single Pokémon that has been paralyzed.

name: Full Heal
effect: A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective. It can be used to heal all the status conditions of a single Pokémon.

name: Heal Powder
effect: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Lava Cookie
effect: Lavaridge Town’s local specialty. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Old Gateau
effect: The Old Chateau’s hidden specialty. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Casteliacone
effect: Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve ice cream. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Lumiose Galette
effect: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Shalour Sable
effect: Shalour City’s famous shortbread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Big Malasada
effect: The Alola region’s local specialty—fried bread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Net Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when attempting to catch Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.

name: Dive Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well when catching Pokémon that live underwater.

name: Nest Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.

name: Repeat Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on a Pokémon species that has been caught before.

name: Timer Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes progressively more effective at catching Pokémon the more turns that are taken in battle.

name: Luxury Ball
effect: A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.

name: Premier Ball
effect: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was made as a commemorative item used to celebrate an event of some sort.

name: Dusk Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places such as caves.

name: Heal Ball
effect: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a Pokémon caught with it and eliminates any status conditions.

name: Quick Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more successful catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

name: Cherish Ball
effect: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been crafted in order to commemorate a special occasion of some sort.

name: Dream Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon while they’re asleep.

name: Beast Ball
effect: A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a low success rate for catching a Pokémon.

name: Exp Share
effect: Turning on this special device will allow all the Pokémon on your team to receive Exp. Points from battles.

name: Soothe Bell
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting chime of this bell calms the holder, making it friendly.

name: Amulet Coin
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any prize money received if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

name: Cleanse Tag
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of the party.

name: Everstone
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A Pokémon holding this peculiar stone is prevented from evolving.

name: Lucky Egg
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s an egg filled with happiness that earns the holder extra Exp. Points in battle.

name: Luck Incense
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any prize money received if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

name: Pure Incense
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of the party.

name: Hp Up
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the HP base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Protein
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the Attack base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Iron
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the Defense base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Carbos
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the Speed base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Calcium
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the Sp. Atk base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Rare Candy
effect: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed, it will instantly raise the level of a single Pokémon by one.

name: Pp Up
effect: A medicine that slightly raises the max PP of a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

name: Zinc
effect: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the Sp. Def base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Pp Max
effect: A medicine that optimally raises the max PP of a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

name: Health Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the HP base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Muscle Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the Attack base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Resist Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the Defense base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Genius Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the Sp. Atk base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Clever Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the Sp. Def base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Swift Wing
effect: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the Speed base points of a single Pokémon.

name: Ability Capsule
effect: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used.
